SPScript Docs
Class: Permissions

Permissions

new Permissions(baseUrl, dao)

Allows you to to check on the security of a list or site. You shouldn't be creating instances of the this class, you will get it from the Web or List class.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
baseUrl string Url to the securable
dao IBaseDao Data access object used to make requests.
Source:
  • permissions.js, line 17
Examples

Access Permissions class using the 'permissions' property on a Web

var dao = new SPScript.RestDao(_spPageContextInfo.webAbsoluteUrl);

dao.web.permissions.getRoleAssignments()
    .then(function(roleAssignments) { console.log(roleAssignments) });

Access Permissions class using the 'permissions' property on a List

dao.lists("Restricted Library").permissions.getRoleAssignments()
    .then(function(roleAssignments) { console.log(roleAssignments) });

Methods

check(emailopt) → {Promise.<Array>}

Gets all the role assignments on that securable. If you don't pass an email, it will use the current user.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
email string <optional>
 If you don't pass an email it will use current user
Source:
  • permissions.js, line 48
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves to an array of string base permission values
Type
Promise.<Array>
Examples

Get the current users permissions on a site

dao.web.permissions.check()
    .then(function(basePermissions) { console.log(basePermissions) });

Get a specified user's permissions on a list

var email = "andrew@andrewpetersen.onmicrosoft.com"
dao.lists("Restricted Library").permissions.check(email)
    .then(function(basePermissions) { console.log(basePermissions) });

getRoleAssignments() → {Promise.<Array.<RoleAssignment>>}

Gets all the role assignments on that securable
Source:
  • permissions.js, line 29
Returns:
- A Promise that resolves to an array of role assignments
Type
Promise.<Array.<RoleAssignment>>
Example
dao.web.permissions.getRoleAssignments()
    .then(function(roleAssignments) { console.log(roleAssignments) });
